common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot being unresponsive, slow, or returning errors like "Something went wrong with processing". Issues appear across OS platforms and Pieces versions. Suggested workarounds include ensuring Pieces is updated, using the GPT4o model, signing into Pieces, and potentially removing any registered OpenAI API keys. The Pieces team is investigating the root causes and working on fixes.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Issue Summary: "Context issue with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o"

**Key Points:**

* User reported a context issue when using a specific file with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.
* Two issues were identified:
    * Context not including the file.
    * Line numbers wrapping incorrectly.

**Solutions:**

* Team diagnosed the context issue and developed a fix.
* Line number wrapping issue assigned for investigation.

**Outcome:**

* Context issue resolved in version 11.0.4 released on 2025-01-16.
* Line number wrapping fix planned for a future patch.

**Current Status:**

* Context issue resolved.
* Line number wrapping under investigation.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @gittydia reported an issue with Pieces Copilot responding "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing..."

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue seems related to Copilot functionality, potentially affecting several users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support identified a potential fix in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4, scheduled for Thursday.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is requested to report back on Friday if the issue persists after the update.
* The issue remains open pending further confirmation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The support team provided links to relevant resources for troubleshooting and documentation.

**Overall:**

The issue appears to be related to a known bug with Copilot responses, and a potential fix is expected to be released soon. The user will need to confirm if the issue is resolved after the update.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues with Claude and Gemini models, including invalid API keys and errors.
* The recommended solution is to switch to the GPT4o model, update to the latest version (11.0.3), and ensure you are signed in to Pieces.
* If issues persist, removing the OpenAI API key may be a temporary fix, but it's currently not recommended to register your key.

**Problems:**

* Claude and Gemini models are experiencing issues.
* User API keys are becoming invalid.
* Users are facing errors even with valid API keys.

**Solutions:**

* Switch to GPT4o model.
* Update to latest version (11.0.3).
* Sign in to Pieces.
* Remove OpenAI API key (temporary solution).

**Current Status:**

* The issue with Claude and Gemini models is being actively investigated.
* The recommended workaround is to switch to GPT4o model.
* Removing OpenAI API key may resolve the issue temporarily, but its registration is not recommended at this time.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is ongoing and a permanent solution is not yet available.
* Users are advised to use GPT4o model as a workaround.
* Further investigation is needed to resolve the root cause of the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues in remote environments
common_issues.description: Users experience difficulties connecting Pieces OS to IDE extensions (VSCode, JetBrains) in remote environments like WSL2 and Docker. Issues include Copilot rendering failures and general connection problems. Solutions involve ensuring network accessibility, adjusting Pieces OS settings, and using updated plugin versions.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Network issues are a known problem within WSL2.
* The `Pieces VSCode extension` can connect to `Pieces OS` but cannot render the `Copilot`.
* The possibility of a relationship to snap installation is raised.

**Problems Identified:**

* The `Copilot` is not being rendered properly within the `Pieces VSCode extension`.
* The root cause of the issue is unclear, with both WSL2 and snap installation being potential suspects.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Enabling the `Systemd` option in WSL2.
* Enabling the `dns-tunnel` in WSL2.
* Further investigation is ongoing.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* Investigation into the root cause and potential solutions is ongoing.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems specific to the `Pieces VSCode extension` and `Pieces OS`.
* The author plans to update the ticket with further information as it becomes available.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * Malanciault encountered an error connecting to Pieces OS in VS Code, even with a remote instance. * Robert identified the issue as server listening only on loopback interface by default, causing connection problems from DevContainer. **Problems Identified:** * Server listens on loopback interface, preventing remote access. * Webview tool windows don't recognize `host.docker.internal` resolution. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Release a patch to allow listening on all interfaces. * Update VSCode plugin to allow automatic detection of Pieces OS and remove the need for custom URL. **Current Status/Outcome:** * VSCode plugin version 2.0.2 released, resolving the issue. * Malanciault confirmed the issue is resolved. **Additional Notes:** * A temporary workaround was offered involving DNS manipulation, but ultimately resolved by the patch. * Communication was helpful and timely, leading to a successful resolution. * The issue was caused by changes in Pieces OS version 11.0.0.

Jetbrains plugin not connecting to pieces OS even though it is online 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a336b09-c8ed-4d3a-88c3-f9f582f95f4d)

## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS Jetbrains plugin issue

**Key points raised:**

* @Farhan-Nahiyan reported an issue with the Jetbrains plugin on Pieces OS.

**Problems identified:**

* The nature of the issue is unclear, but it requires logs and potentially a live debugging session to diagnose.
* A potential solution involving a development build was proposed.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @caleb-at-pieces requested logs from @Farhan-Nahiyan to investigate the issue further.
* A development build of Pieces OS was created and shared with @Farhan-Nahiyan for testing.
* Instructions were provided on how to install and test the development build.

**Current status/outcome:**

* @Farhan-Nahiyan has not yet provided feedback on the development build. 
* The issue remains unresolved as of the last update on 2024-10-11T19:43:11+00:00.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with Pieces OS and Desktop app, including Neural Code Search not returning results, app launch failures on Windows and macOS, and Copilot not providing feedback. Troubleshooting steps include checking for updates, providing log files, and waiting for new releases. Some issues are unresolved and under investigation.

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces OS not Launching

**Key points raised:**

* Multiple users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS, both on Windows and macOS.
* The issue manifests in several ways:
    * Button briefly greys out, then returns to normal with no launch.
    * Clicking launch button does nothing.
    * Blue outline of the window appears, but nothing else.
    * Pieces OS fails to connect, even when installed.
* The issue seems to be specific to Pieces OS and not other Pieces applications.

**Problems identified:**

* The root cause of the issue is not identified in the conversation.
* Users are unable to use Pieces OS effectively due to the launch failure.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* No specific solutions are proposed, but users are asked to provide log files and confirm installation updates.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved as of the last comment on November 8th, 2025.

**Additional observations:**

* The issue appears to have been ongoing for several months, with reports dating back to May 2024.
* Users are experiencing the issue across different operating systems (Windows and macOS), as well as different browsers (Chrome and Brave).

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, launch failures, and loading screen freezes.  Suggested solutions include restarting PiecesOS, optimizing memory, and providing log files for troubleshooting.  The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS High RAM Usage and CPU Spikes

This conversation on the Pieces GitHub repository covers the issue of Pieces OS demanding high amounts of RAM and spiking CPU usage, hindering user experience.

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users on various platforms (Linux, macOS, Windows) experience high RAM usage, ranging from 2GB to 5GB, even with limited or no active usage.
* RAM spike issues persist after clicking "Optimize Memory" with usage increasing again immediately.
* CPU usage spikes to ~50% and even as high as 120%, causing substantial performance drops
* These issues make running Pieces impractical at times, forcing some users to uninstall.

**Problems Identified:**

* High RAM utilization, exceeding usual expectations (~2GB) for idle or normal scenarios.
* High CPU spikes, significantly slowing down device performance.
* Ongoing memory leak suspected for exceeding resource usage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* "Optimize Memory" feature to partially address RAM concerns.
* Development focused on improving PiecesOS overall performance and reducing resource intensive tasks.
* Offering personal troubleshooting sessions to investigate individual cases with user collaboration.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* High RAM & CPU usage remains significant for specific users, causing some to abandon Pieces despite its positive features.
* Ongoing optimization endeavors target resolving these difficulties.

**Possible Solutions Not Yet Mentioned in Comments:**

* Implementing "off-device" processing/computation options: This might be implemented for tasks not requiring live interaction
* Providing configuration tweaks for users to personalize resource allocation and trade-off performance for lower resource burden.
* Improved on-device AI model caching and memory management systems. 

Further community feedback remains essential to prioritize fixing these issues. Addressing the concerns outlined in this summary is crucial for future development and wider user base expansion for Pieces.

## GitHub Issue Summary 
**Title:** 
* Unable to launch application - stuck on loading screen 

**Key Points:** 

* User Ganesh-2-4 reported the issue of the application getting stuck on the loading screen. 
* The issue was acknowledged by Rosie, a support representative at Pieces. 

**Problems Identified:**

* The application fails to launch and remains stuck on the loading screen. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Rosie requested Ganesh-2-4 to submit their log files located at "Documents > com.pieces.os" for further analysis and troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The issue remains open, with the support team investigating the problem based on the provided logs. 

**Note:**
* This summary is based on the limited information available in the provided conversation excerpt.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported issues with the Pieces Desktop Application on macOS and Windows. Issues include a "Welcome Message" appearing repeatedly, Copilot functionality not working, and the application getting stuck on the loading screen. Proposed solutions involve bug fixes in upcoming releases and analysis of user log files.

**Additional Notes:**

**Overall, the conversation highlights the identification of a bug in the Desktop App, the successful reproduction of the bug, and the implementation of a fix that will be released in the next app update.**

recommendations: **Prioritize 'Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Errors'**: This issue has the highest frequency and is impacting users across platforms. Focus on identifying the root cause and implementing a permanent fix.

**Address 'Pieces OS connection issues in remote environments'**: This is a recurring problem with a high activity level. Improve documentation and troubleshooting steps for remote environments, and investigate solutions for seamless integration in WSL2 and Docker.

**Investigate 'Pieces OS and Desktop App Functionality Issues'**: These issues, including Neural Code Search failures and launch problems, indicate potential core functionality bugs. Prioritize investigation and resolution in upcoming releases.
**Monitor 'PiecesOS Launch and Performance Issues'**: High resource usage can be detrimental to user experience. Continue optimizing PiecesOS for better performance and resource management.
**Review and address bugs related to the Pieces Desktop Application**: Issues like the recurring 'Welcome Message' and loading screen freezes need to be addressed for a smoother user experience.
**Improve communication and transparency**: Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned fixes, and estimated timelines. Provide clear workarounds and troubleshooting steps where applicable.
**Gather more detailed logs and user feedback**: Encourage users to submit detailed logs and feedback for more effective troubleshooting and issue resolution.
**Consider automated testing for common issues**: Implement automated testing to catch common bugs and regressions early in the development cycle.
**Create a comprehensive knowledge base**: Develop a detailed knowledge base with FAQs, troubleshooting guides, and known issue documentation for users and support staff.
**Analyze ticket trends**: Regularly analyze ticket data to identify recurring issues, emerging trends, and areas for improvement in the software or support processes.
